publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Io. Nordenivale, ad primam par∣tem sui SPECVLI BRITANNIAE.

monogr.title: Speculum Britanniae. The first parte an historicall, & chorographicall discription of Middlesex. Wherein are also alphabeticallie sett downe, the names of the cyties, townes, parishes hamletes, howses of name &c. W.th direction spedelie to finde anie place desired in the mappe & the distance betwene place and place without compasses. Cum priuilegio. By the trauaile and vew of Iohn Norden. Anno 1593
monogr.author: Norden, John
monogr.extent: 8, 48, 4 pages, 3 folded plates, maps, coats of arms (woodcuts), 4°

keywords.term: Travel, topography, maps and navigational manuals

div.head: Io. Nordenivale, ad primam partem sui SPECVLI BRITANNIAE.
div.l: VAde liber Speculi caput es, tua mēbra sequentur,
ELISABETHA potens, arx{que} patrona tua est.
Quid si in te domin úm{que} tuum ruet inuidus audax?
Tu dominúsque tuus, tutus inermis eris.
Ito foràs, valeásque liber, te forte sagaces
Ibis in orbe gerens, quamuis tua fata libelle,
Haec tibi conductum, non te pericula tangunt,
Digna patrona illa est, spesque, salusque tua.
